name: ZK Proofs: A Case Study Integrating Taiwan's Official Identity APIs
description: Identity verification is a common application in daily life, but digital identity systems that prioritize privacy through cryptography are less common. In this talk, I will share a real-world identity verification project that integrates with an official APIs from the Taiwanese government. The project uses the Semaphore framework for zero-knowledge proofs to protect private data, and it also complies with the standards set by W3C for Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs).

speakers.name: Yuren Ju
speakers.bio: As a passionate software developer, exploring new advancements in the field has always been a focus. Previous work includes projects related to Wallet as a Service and Decentralized Finance (DeFi). The most recent project focuses on developing a system compliant with W3C DIDs (Decentralized Identifiers) and Semaphore protocols, while also integrating the official identity verification API from the Taiwanese government.
